snippet: Government officials said the people checked into a hospital not far from the central Mexican town where a stolen truck carrying radioactive cobalt 60 was found abandoned.
abstract: Mexican authorities arrest six people in connection with theft of truck carrying highly radioactive waste in episode that caused international scare and raised concerns about transporting nuclear material; material, known as cobalt 60, is common ingredient in dirty bombs; it remains unclear whether thieves wanted truck, material or both.

byline.original: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD and PAULINA VILLEGAS
byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Government officials said the people checked into a hospital not far from the central Mexican town where a stolen truck carrying radioactive cobalt 60 was found abandoned.

headline.main: 6 Arrested in Theft of Truck With Radioactive Waste
headline.print_headline: 6 Arrested in Theft of Truck With Radioactive Waste
